definition: not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
(negative prefix)/not/no
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly

sentences.english: I shook my head reprovingly, and then she blushed and whispered.
sentences.chinese: 我不以为然地摇摇头，于是她脸红了，小声说。
塔尔坎对这一提议不以为然。

sentences.english: Looking at it, Zi Gong felt it was out of convenance.
sentences.chinese: 子贡看见这样的行径，大不以为然。

sentences.english: The disaccord in my words is hardly to cover the endorse in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 嘴上的不以为然，只是在掩饰我内心的完全赞同。

sentences.english: But Jefferson, the chief architect of the Declaration of Independence, believed otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 但《独立宣言》的设计师杰斐逊不以为然。

sentences.english: "I think very differently, " answered Elizabeth, shortly;
sentences.chinese: “我却大不以为然，”伊丽莎白简慢地答道。

sentences.english: Initially, it costs the consumer nothing to throw away a plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 起初，消费者随意的扔弃一个塑料袋都不以为然。

sentences.english: "Do you have scruples about that old headman in the temple?"The sea pumice disagrees a way.
sentences.chinese: “你顾忌宫里那个老头子？”海浮石不以为然道。

sentences.english: The Christianity rises, the church disagrees very much to the herding absolute being stanza customs.
sentences.chinese: 基督教兴起，教会对牧神节风俗很不以为然。

sentences.english: His views on capital punishment are unpalatable to many.
sentences.chinese: 他对死刑存废的见解许多人都不以为然。

sentences.english: Can't repeat the past?" he cried incredulously."
sentences.chinese: “不能重温旧梦？”他大不以为然地喊到。

sentences.english: People all say "The famous master has no greats students", I only disagree.
sentences.chinese: 人们都说“名师出高徒”，我独不以为然。

sentences.english: She had a morbid detestation of Li Hua's commercial schemes.
sentences.chinese: 她对展览馆的商业计划很不以为然。

sentences.english: Rifle in hand, he entered the room.
But India takes a dim view of China's cooperation with archrival Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 不过，印度对中国与其劲敌巴基斯坦的合作不以为然。

sentences.english: I'm reading Reader's Digest in the kitchen. I am totally nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: 我在厨房里看读者文摘，完全不以为然。

definition: not to mind/unconcerned
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to pay no attention to/not to mind
to not understand/to be puzzled by/indissoluble
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
displeased/annoyed
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
to mock/to ridicule
to satirize/to ridicule/to mock
to contempt/to disdain/pejorative
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
